channel.title: What determines order of usernames listed on right click
channel.description:
When you're standing at the bank and there are like 20 people under you, what determines the order of the usernames when you right click? I always thought it was combat level, but I guess I never paid attention because it's definitely not that.
I was thinking that it's the order the server loads them in, because it seems completely random 100% of the time I run away from the bank and back or logout/login.

item.title: What determines order of usernames listed on right click
item.dc:creator: @maminerr maminerr
item.description:
@maminerr wrote:

[quote=“BloodRayne, post:6, topic:347089”][quote author=Ollie link=topic=443466.msg3256610#msg3256610 date=1278165878]
It works exactly the same way as a stack does in Java, when a player moves onto the stack they are pushed onto the stack, when a player walks off they are popped off the stack and it allows for someone to take their place.
[/quote]

So if that’s true, the longer you’re standing(and the more people to come and go with you not moving), the farther down you’ll go?[/quote]

correct

Read full topic
item.source: What determines order of usernames listed on right click

item.title: What determines order of usernames listed on right click
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

Ollie:

It works exactly the same way as a stack does in Java, when a player moves onto the stack they are pushed onto the stack, when a player walks off they are popped off the stack and it allows for someone to take their place.

So if that’s true, the longer you’re standing(and the more people to come and go with you not moving), the farther down you’ll go?

Read full topic

item.title: What determines order of usernames listed on right click
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

No it’s definitely not level based. There are low levels at the top just as often as there are higher levels :\

Read full topic
